RuleName: Column references should be fully qualified

Rule.Name: Column references should be fully qualified
Rule.Description: Using fully qualified column references makes it easier to distinguish between column and measure references, and also helps avoid certain errors.
Rule.Expression: DependsOn.Any(Key.ObjectType = "Column" and Value.Any(not FullyQualified))

ObjectName: [Total Previous Quarter Gross Profit Proportion to QTD]
RuleName: Avoid division (use DIVIDE function instead)

Rule.Name: Avoid division (use DIVIDE function instead)
Rule.Description: Calculated Columns, Measures or Calculated Tables should not use the division symbol in their expressions (/) unless the denominator is a constant value. Instead, it is advised to always use the DIVIDE(<numerator>,<denominator>) function.
Rule.Expression:
Tokenize().Any(
    Type = DIV and
    Next.Type <> INTEGER_LITERAL and
    Next.Type <> REAL_LITERAL
)

RuleName: Provide format string for visible numeric columns

Rule.Name: Provide format string for visible numeric columns
Rule.Description: Visible numeric columns should have their Format String property assigned
Rule.Expression:
IsVisible
and string.IsNullOrWhitespace(FormatString)
and (DataType = "Int64" or DataType = "DateTime" or DataType = "Double" or DataType = "Decimal")

RuleName: Disable attribute hierachies to decrease processing

Rule.Name: Disable attribute hierachies to decrease processing
Rule.Description: Disable Attribute hierarchies for hidden collumns. This will ensure faster processing.
Rule.Expression:
not IsVisible
and IsAvailableInMDX
and not UsedInHierarchies.Any()
and not UsedInVariations.Any()
and not UsedInSortBy.Any()

RuleName: Do not use floating point data types

Rule.Name: Do not use floating point data types
Rule.Description: Floating point datatypes can cause unexpected results when evaluating values close to 0. Use Currency / Fixed Decimal Number (decimal) instead.
Rule.Expression: DataType = "Double"

RuleName: Do not use floating point data types

Rule.Name: Do not use floating point data types
Rule.Description: Floating point datatypes can cause unexpected results when evaluating values close to 0. Use Currency / Fixed Decimal Number (decimal) instead.
Rule.Expression: DataType = "Double"

RuleName: Do not use floating point data types

Rule.Name: Do not use floating point data types
Rule.Description: Floating point datatypes can cause unexpected results when evaluating values close to 0. Use Currency / Fixed Decimal Number (decimal) instead.
Rule.Expression: DataType = "Double"

RuleName: Don't summarize numeric columns

Rule.Name: Don't summarize numeric columns
Rule.Description: Set the SummarizeBy property of all visible numeric columns to "None", to avoid unintentional summarization in client tools. Create measures for columns that are supposed to be summarized.
Rule.Expression:
IsVisible
and SummarizeBy <> "None"
and (DataType = "Double" or DataType = "Decimal" or DataType = "Int64")

RuleName: Organize columns and hierarchies in display folders

Rule.Name: Organize columns and hierarchies in display folders
Rule.Description: Tables with more than 10 visible columns and/or hierarchies should have them organized in display folders for improved usability.
Rule.Expression:
Columns.Count(IsVisible and string.IsNullOrEmpty(DisplayFolder)) +
Hierarchies.Count(IsVisible and string.IsNullOrEmpty(DisplayFolder))
> 10

RuleName: Avoid CamelCase on visible columns and hierarchies

Rule.Name: Avoid CamelCase on visible columns and hierarchies
Rule.Description: Visible columns and hierarchies should not use CamelCase in their names, unless translations are applied
Rule.Expression:
IsVisible 
and RegEx.IsMatch(Name, "[A-Z]([A-Z0-9]*[a-z][a-z0-9]*[A-Z]|[a-z0-9]*[A-Z][A-Z0-9]*[a-z])[A-Za-z0-9]*") 
and not Name.Contains(" ") 
and (Model.Cultures.Count = 0 or TranslatedNames.Any(it = "" or it = outerIt.Name))

Rule.Name: Avoid CamelCase on visible columns and hierarchies
Rule.Description: Visible columns and hierarchies should not use CamelCase in their names, unless translations are applied

and not Name.Contains(" ") 
and (Model.Cultures.Count = 0 or TranslatedNames.Any(it = "" or it = outerIt.Name))

RuleName: Avoid single-attribute dimensions that are not shared by multiple facts

Rule.Name: Avoid single-attribute dimensions that are not shared by multiple facts
Rule.Description: In general, over-normalization should be avoided. If a dimension only holds a single attribute and the dimension is not shared by multiple facts, consider moving the attribute to the fact table.
Rule.Expression:
Columns.Count(IsVisible and not UsedInRelationships.Any()) <= 1 and
Model.Relationships.Count(ToTable = outerIt) = 1

RuleName: Avoid single-attribute dimensions that are not shared by multiple facts

Rule.Name: Avoid single-attribute dimensions that are not shared by multiple facts
Rule.Description: In general, over-normalization should be avoided. If a dimension only holds a single attribute and the dimension is not shared by multiple facts, consider moving the attribute to the fact table.
Rule.Expression:
Columns.Count(IsVisible and not UsedInRelationships.Any()) <= 1 and
Model.Relationships.Count(ToTable = outerIt) = 1

RuleName: Remove unused columns

Rule.Name: Remove unused columns
Rule.Description: Hidden columns, which do not have any dependencies, are not used in any relationships, not used in any hierarchies and not used as the SortByColumn for other columns, will likely not be used by clients and thus take up unnecessary space. Consider removing the columns from the model to save space and improve processing time, if you are certain that no external DAX or MDX queries make use of the columns.
Rule.Expression:
not IsVisible

and ReferencedBy.Count = 0 

and (not UsedInRelationships.Any())

and (not UsedInSortBy.Any())

and (not UsedInHierarchies.Any())

and (not UsedInVariations.Any())

RuleName: Remove unused columns

Rule.Name: Remove unused columns
Rule.Description: Hidden columns, which do not have any dependencies, are not used in any relationships, not used in any hierarchies and not used as the SortByColumn for other columns, will likely not be used by clients and thus take up unnecessary space. Consider removing the columns from the model to save space and improve processing time, if you are certain that no external DAX or MDX queries make use of the columns.
Rule.Expression:
not IsVisible

and ReferencedBy.Count = 0 

and (not UsedInRelationships.Any())

and (not UsedInSortBy.Any())

and (not UsedInHierarchies.Any())

and (not UsedInVariations.Any())

RuleName: Specify Application Name in connection string

Rule.Name: Specify Application Name in connection string
Rule.Description: When connecting to a SQL Server data source, specify an Application Name in your connection string to let your DBA know where the connection is coming from. For example, you could specify "AnalysisServicesTabular <ServerName> <ModelName>" replacing <ServerName> with the name of your AS instance and <ModelName> with the name of your model.
Rule.Expression:
(ConnectionString.IndexOf("SQLNCLI", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase) >= 0 or
ConnectionString.IndexOf("SQLOLEDB", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase) >= 0 or
ConnectionString.IndexOf("MSOLEDBSQL", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase) >= 0) and ConnectionString.IndexOf("Application Name", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase) < 0

RuleName: Use MSOLEDBSQL provider

Rule.Name: Use MSOLEDBSQL provider
Rule.Description: Data source providers SQLOLEDB and SQLNCLI have been deprecated. Use MSOLEDBSQL instead. Set the "Provider" property to "System.Data.OleDb" and ensure that the connection string specified MSOLEDBSQL as "Provider". More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/connect/oledb/oledb-driver-for-sql-server?view=sql-server-ver15
Rule.Expression:
ConnectionString.IndexOf("SQLNCLI", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase) >= 0 or
ConnectionString.IndexOf("SQLOLEDB", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase) >= 0
